thread.title: Sports Roundup: Hendrix and UCA volleyball and soccer
thread.title_full: Sports Roundup: Hendrix and UCA volleyball and soccer

author: Staff
title: Sports Roundup: Hendrix and UCA volleyball and soccer
text:
Sports Roundup: Hendrix and UCA volleyball and soccer Posted: October 10, 2015 - 9:49pm LOG CABIN DEMOCRAT 
BIRMINGHAM, ALA. — It took five sets but Hendrix’s team completed a perfect run through the first half of the Southern Athletic Association season Saturday with a 25-21, 25-19, 17-25, 22-25, 15-12 victory over second-place Birminham-Southern. The Warriors are 14-6, 8-0 in conference. BSU fell to 15-3, 6-2. UCA VOLLEYBALL 
THIBODAUX, La. — The University of Central Arkansas volleyball team defeated Nicholls, 25-20, 25-15, 25-23, Saturday for its first road victory. The Sugar Bears are 10-10 and 6-2 in thr Southland Conference. Nicholls fell to 5-13, 0-6. UCA WOMEN’S SOCCER 
UCA’s women’s soccer team played Southland Conference leader Stephen F. Austin to a 1-1 tie Friday night at the Bill Stephens Complex. 
The Ladyjacks (5-6-2, 4-0-2) scored early in the second half but the Bears (6-7-1, 3-2-1) evened it in the 88th minute when Stacia Carroll launched the ball from midfield and SFA keeper Lillie Ehlert misplayed it and it bounced over her head into the goal. 
“It’s interesting, because both goals tonight were not really great plays,” said Central Arkansas head coach Jeremy Bishop. “As good as the match tonight was, they weren’t necessarily very good soccer plays. But Stacia does a good job of putting the ball into dangerous positons on her crosses, and on a night like tonight, when the ball is skipping a bit, you get lucky” In net for the Bears, Anna Hughes made a career-high 13 saves. HENDRIX WOMEN’S SOCCER 
DANVILLE, Ky. - The Hendrix College women’s soccer team (8-4-1, 1-2) lost to NO. 17 Centre College, 2-0 ,in Southern Athletic Association road action on Friday night. 
The host Colonels (9-1-1, 1-0-1) got a pair of goals from Destinie Graves, the second leading scorer in the SAA behind Hendrix sophomore Lucy Moore, in the 40th and 60th minutes.
